citeinfo.title: Digital Elevation Model, 0.25 m, Barrow Environmental Observatory, Alaska, 2013

descript.abstract: This 0.25m horizontal resolution digital elevation model, DEM, was developed from Airborne Laser Altimetry flown by Aerometric Inc, now known as Quantum Spatial, Inc. on 12 July, 2013. One Mission was flown and the data jointly processed with LANL personnel to produce a 0.25m DEM covering a region approximately 2.8km wide and 12.4km long extending from the coast above North Salt Lagoon to south of Gas Well Road. This DEM encompasses a diverse range of hydrologic, geomorphic, geophysical and biological features typical of the Barrow Peninsula. Vertical accuracy at the 95% confidence interval was computed as 0.143m. The coordinate system, datum, and geoid for this DEM are UTM Zone 4N, NAD83 (2011), NAVD88 (GEOID09). Dataset DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.5440/1224720
descript.purpose: 0.25m LiDAR dataset acquired for an area near Barrow, Alaska on 12 July, 2013. Data were collected to improved characterization of key landscape elevation features such as polygonal terrain and hydrologic drainage features. This DEM encompasses a diverse range of hydrologic, geomorphic, geophysical and biological features typical of the Barrow Peninsula.

idinfo.useconst: Use of this data recommends the user collaborates with the NGEE LiDAR data PI, Cathy Wilson, and involve her as a co-author on presentations and publications resulting from its use. LA-UR-15-28483 (Los Alamos Unlimited Release Unclassified Document number)

qattracc.attraccv: Vertical accuracy at the 95% confidence interval was computed as 0.143m. The coordinate system, datum, and geoid for this DEM are UTM Zone 4N, NAD83 (2011), NAVD88 (GEOID09).

dataqual.logic: Aerometric provided further QC procedures involving the comparison of LiDAR data points with field-survey data to remove any atmospheric bias encountered during data collection. This process involves statistically comparing the LiDAR "bare-earth" surface to collected ground survey data, determining and applying a vertical offset, and generating final statistics to determine the vertical accuracy of the data. Contact data PI to obtain Aerometric statistical summary of the vertical accuracy results [file: Barrow_LiDAR_Vertical_Accuracy_Results.xls].

procstep.procdesc: We used 285 checkpoints acquired by UMIAQ to compute the vertical accuracy. The computed RMSE at the 95th percentile confidence interval was 0.143 meters, meeting the general LiDAR data vertical accuracy specifications. A mosaic was created using the 142 geotiff files produced by Aerometric to create a single 0.25 horizontal resolution DEM dataset.

cntperp.cntorg: Next-Generation Ecosystem Experiments (NGEE) Arctic Project, Oak Ridge National Laboratory

cntaddr.address: SM-30 Bikini Atoll Rd, MS J-495

metainfo.metstdn: FDGC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata and Biological Data Profile

ome.datause: This 0.25m DEM was produced in geotiff format using the UTM Zone 4N coordinate system with the NAD83 horizontal datum, and the NAVD88 (GEOID09) vertical datum.
